III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not
limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing
a youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth went AWOL on 11/21/23 because a staff member was
hitting youth. Youth had a split and swollen lip and multiple marks
and bruises on their body.
Investigation This complaint was received on 11/28/2023 and assigned for joint
investigation with MDHHS Specialist.
I interviewed Youth A’s Foster Care Worker on 11/28/2023 at the
agency. Foster Care Worker reported she met with Youth A on
11/20/2023 and he did not report any issues or concerns. She
said Youth A called his grandmother when he AWOLed and told
her he AWOLed because staff hit him. She said Youth A has
never disclosed any abuse by staff. She reported Youth A recently
had a psychological evaluation and IQ assessment and is
cognitively delayed.
I interviewed Director on 11/28/2023 at the agency, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Director reported Youth A
and another Youth AWOLed on 11/21/2023 and did not return to
campus until 11/24/2023. He does not know where the two youths
were for four days. There are no incident reports involving Youth
A and staff and Youth A has not reported any issues with staff.
I interviewed Youth A on 11/28/2023 at the agency. In
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Youth A was observed, and
his lower lip appeared to be chapped. Youth A was asked if staff
hit him, and he denied any physical abuse by staff. He said Staff 3
annoys him, but staff do not physically discipline him. Youth A
reported he and Youth B AWOLed on 11/21/2023 and were gone
for four days, because they didn’t want to spend thanksgiving at
the campus. He refused to answer any questions related to his
AWOL. Youth A said he cut his lip while wrestling with another
youth. He could not remember the other youth’s name or when it
happened.
2

I interviewed Youth B on 11/28/2023 at the agency, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Youth B admitted he
AWOLed on 11/21/2023 with Youth A. Youth B didn’t want Youth
A to go with him, but Youth A followed him. Youth B didn’t want to
spend thanksgiving at the cottage, so he and Youth A went to one
of his friend’s house and walked around the city. Youth B denied
witnessing Staff hitting Youth A. He said staff argue with them and
take away privileges when the kids break the rules, but they don’t
use physical discipline. Youth B said he does not like when staff
try to tell him what to do, but he feels safe at the campus.
I interviewed Staff 1 on 11/28/2023 at the agency, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 1 is a youth specialist and has been
working at the agency for almost 3 years. Staff 1 reported he was
working on 11/21/2023 and followed Youth A and Youth B when
they went AWOL on 11/21/2023. Once he lost sight of the two
youths, he filed a police report and completed the incident report.
He recalled on that day Youth A and Youth B were triggered and
they said they didn’t want to spend thanksgiving at the cottage. He
said staff attempted to talk to and discourage the youths from
AWOLing, but both Youths are easily triggered when they are told
what to do. Staff 1 denied witnessing any staff hit or have any
physical contact with Youth A. He denied Youth A had a injured lip
on 11/21/2023 prior to him going AWOL.
I interviewed Staff 2 on 11/29/2023 at the agency in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 2 is a youth specialist and has been
working at the agency for two months. Staff 2 recalled working on
11/21/2023 and reported Youth A got triggered when staff told him
to go and shower. He said Youth A and Youth B were telling the
other youths they were going to AWOL. He said Staff 1 followed
Youth A and Youth B when they AWOLed. Staff 2 denied any staff
hit or physically managed Youth A prior to AWOLing or used any
form of physical discipline with Youth A.
I interviewed Staff 3 on 11/29/2023 at the agency in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 3 is a youth specialist and has been
working at the agency for seven months. Staff 3 reported he was
picking up another youth from school on 11/21/2023 and was not
present when Youth A and Youth B AWOLed. He denied hitting or
physically managing Youth A. Staff 3 said Youth A is easily
triggered and usually is just looking for an excuse to AWOL.
He denied seeing Youth A after returning from AWOL on
11/24/2023, as supervisors have to search the youth prior to them
being allowed back into the cottages.
I interviewed Staff 4 on 11/29/2023 at the agency in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 4 reported that she was present on
3

11/21/2023 when Youth A and Youth B AWOLed. She reported
Youth A and Youth B frequently AWOL and they AWOLed several
times last week. She denied hearing about or seeing any physical
altercation between Youth A and Staff 3. She said Youth A is very
aggressive, he broke a light fixture last week, assaulted staff, and
threatened to stab staff. She denied seeing any marks or bruises
on Youth A.
I interviewed Nurse on 11/30/2023 via telephone. Nurse reported
she examined Youth A on 11/28/2023, Youth A had a bruise on
his knee and elbow and a chapped upper lip due to dry lips. She
said Youth reported the bruise on his knee and elbow are due to
falling.
A predisposition conference held with MDHHS Specialist on
12/18/2023. There is no finding by MDHHS Specialist.
Documents reviewed:
• Incident report dated 11/21/2023 completed by Staff 1.
Report noted Youth A self-triggered, ran out of the cottage,
and ran through the woods behind the cottage. Staff
followed until line of sight was lost. Staff filed AWOL police
report #23-2558. Youth A returned to campus on 11/24/2023.
• Incident report dated 11/25/2023 completed by Staff 2.
Reported Youth A was triggered because he wanted to go
outside and AWOLed when staff told him he could not go
outside.
• Incident report dated 11/26/2023 completed by Staff 3.
Property destruction, physical aggression, verbal
aggression/threatening language, and AWOL. The report
stated Youth A was in bathroom with a sharp object. Youth
attempted to stab Staff 3 with the sharp object, tried to take
the mirror off the wall and broke a light cover in the
bathroom, and ran out of the cottage. The police were
contacted, and a police report completed. The staff and
youths were not injured, and no restraint was utilized.
• Medical assessment for Youth A, dated 11/28/2023,
completed by Nurse. Youth A was examined by Nurse on
11/28/2023, Youth has a scrap on his knee. Youth reported
scrap on knee is from a fall. Youth denied being hurt by
staff.
• Personnel file for Staff 3 showed no disciplinary action.
• Facility’s AWOL policy: Staff are expected to make all efforts
to maintain eyesight of the youth(s). If youths leave the
grounds, staff should get a van and follow them. If youths
AWOL but stay on campus and go into the woods, staff
should contact the supervisor, follow calmly on foot, and
verbally attempt to return them. Staff must follow youths as far
4

as possible without endangering their own safety. If youths
retreat further into the woods and staff lose eyesight of them,
the police should be contacted, and a missing person report
filed.
Analysis Based on interviews conducted and documentations reviewed,
there is insufficient evidence to support the allegations staff hit
Youth A. Staff and Youth interviewed denied staff hit Youth A.
Youth A AWOLed on 11/21/2023, returned to campus on
11/24/2023; documentation and staff interviews confirmed staff
followed facility’s policy regarding Youth A AWOLing. Staff
followed Youth A on foot, and when they lost sight a police report
was filed.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
